Description: Bowl. Octagonal, panels decorated with investiture scenes and confronted sphinxes. Glaze has worn away in certain areas, most especially the base. Fritware (stonepaste); moulded with turquoise glaze.
Curator's comments: Octagonal fritware bowl with a moulded decoration under a turquoise glaze West Iran, 12th-13th century The panels contain, alternately, confronted sphinzes and horsemen holding a wreath. The latter is a Sasanian motif seen on the rock reliefs of western Iran.
Bibliographic references: Lane 1947 / Early Islamic Pottery: Mesopotamia, Egypt and Persia (fig.42.A)
Barrett 1950 / The Raphael Bequest II Oriental Antiquities Persian Pottery (p.94-95)
